q1: What is an ISO week number?
a1: ISO 8601 defines week numbering where weeks start on Monday and Week 1 is the week containing January 4th. A year has 52 or 53 weeks.
q2: Why does my week number differ from other systems?
a2: Different countries use different week numbering systems. ISO 8601 starts weeks on Monday, while the US system starts on Sunday.
a3: A quarter divides the year into four 3-month periods: Q1 (Jan-Mar), Q2 (Apr-Jun), Q3 (Jul-Sep), Q4 (Oct-Dec).
